abstract: A federal judge on Tuesday approved a $4.8 million settlement between the Justice Department and Morgan Stanley over accusations of price fixing in the electricity market, even as he said that the settlement amount was too low.
snippet: A federal judge on Tuesday approved a $4.8 million settlement between the Justice Department and Morgan Stanley over accusations of price fixing in the electricity market, even as he said that the settlement amount was too low.
lead_paragraph: Over objections from consumer groups and New York officials, a federal judge on Tuesday approved a $4.8 million settlement between the Justice Department and Morgan Stanley over accusations of price fixing in the electricity market.

headline.main: Federal Judge Grudgingly Approves Morgan Stanley Price-Fixing Case
headline.print_headline: Morgan Penalty In Price-Fixing Gets Approval
